reviews.review_msg: Had him for math151 and also for math152 prime. The prime section was the best course out of all my courses so far. Office hours were the best. Goated.
Honestly the best professor at SFU

Calculus is hard, Jamie makes it easy. Rundown: His midterms are easy to ace if you don't make mistakes and actually attend lectures. Some back things are that you have to pay for webassign. People complain about assignments due weekly but I feel like it's necessary for students to understand the material. 5/5 is too low of a rating imo.

Jamie is very knowledgable and explains material exceptionally well during lectures and in his office hours, he knows what he's doing. As for course material, make sure you practise his assignments and notes lots so you can receive good grades on quizzes and exams. Trust me, you won't regret taking a course with Jamie.

Actual chad of a professor - an absolute joy to learn from. The only issue I have with the course is that the lectures are too short (only the full length of class). As a dude that dislikes calculus (had to take for reqs), this man will make your life a lot easier because he actually explains the material instead of making it worse.
Had him for both math 151 & 152. best prof ever
Mulholland is the only reason I was able to pass my math pre-reqs
